w:r.w:t: This document reflects changes and additions made to Imperial Assault skirmish cards & rules by the IA Continuity Project for casual and competitive play. Cards and rules that are marked
have been tested and approved by the IACP player community as viable for casual & competitive play.
Modifications from the previous version of this Official Changes document are

Whether you are a seasoned player or a new challenger, the IACP Steering Committee wants your feedback about these changes. To read more about the IACP project, download printable card images and see how you can provide feedback, visit
Approved stamp added for Season 10 cards
Continued Testing stamp added for Dengar and Rogue One cards
Meditation and You Will Not Deny Me removed.
Cards can be viewed for posterity here: https://ia-continuityproject.com/2024/02/27/season-9-final-updates-v9-2/

Season Content is developed by the IACP Steering Committee with the guidance of the IACP player community. Starting in August 2020, a Season that introduces modified and new cards and/or rules will last approximately 6 months. The IACP community spends 3 months playtesting these cards in the

. These playtest cards will be labeled as Season X, where X is the current Season number. Cards provided at the start of a Season may be modified mid-Playtest period for balancing purposes. Gameplay during the Playtest Period allows you to experience the newest content in your games and join the playtesting community; it is not recommended for high-level competitive tournaments due to the potential instability of testing material. In the last two weeks of the Playtest Period, the Season's content will be voted upon by the community. Cards & rules that gain a significant amount of support, currently 70%, will become
, meaning the card or rule has been approved for competitive play and will likely not change again. Then the next 3 months of a Season implements the

. Gameplay during the Competitive Period will be stable, providing players to explore new combinations of cards for army building. The IACP community is encouraged to organize & participate in competitive events during a Season's Competitive Period.
Printable card images of the current Season's content can be downloaded at http://ia-continuityproject.com.

Some cards will receive updates outside of a playtesting season and therefore outside of the normal community voting system. Cards that require updated text templating that does not functionally change how they were originally intended to be played will receive the

text at the bottom of their card after they are updated, to indicate to the community that these cards received some type of clarifying errata after they were approved. These cards will not be included in future Community Vote ballots. Cards that require a power level adjustment after they have been approved will receive the

text at the bottom of their card to indicate that these cards were changed in a way that was meant to correct a power level problem after they were approved. Rebalanced cards will be included on the ballot of the next Community Vote to allow the community to decide whether they ultimately approve of keeping the rebalanced versions in the IACP.

Season 6 adds additional keywords to the current roster of keywords included in a figures’ ability bar rather than its text box. These are in addition to existing Imperial Assault keywords like Mobile, Massive, Blast, Pierce, etc. The current ability keywords in IACP are:
: “You ignore additional movement points for difficult terrain and hostile figures.”
: “Figures do not block line of sight for this figure’s attacks.”
: “While attacking, you may reroll 1 attack die.”
Choosing Between IACP and FFG versions
In any instance where a card has an IACP version, players are free to choose between the IACP and original version of the card,
. These cards’ original designs were and are considered problematic and needed to be rebalanced to preserve the game’s competitive integrity.

In cases where players could include multiple copies of a card with the same name in their army, players cannot mix IACP Deployment groups/figures with the original FFG versions if those cards have the same name and same elite (red) or regular (gray) border color. Additionally, players cannot mix IACP and FFG versions of Skirmish Upgrades and Command cards with the same name, regardless of whether the card is regular or elite.
For example, you could choose to play FFG elite Snowtroopers in a list over the IACP Snowtroopers, and you can mix IACP elite Snowtroopers with FFG regular (gray border) Snowtroopers. However you
use 1 group of IACP elite Snowtroopers alongside 1 group of FFG elite (red border) Snowtroopers in the same list.

For Season 8, this means you cannot mix the IACP versions of Vaders Finest in a list with the FFG version of Vaders Finest, as both are skirmish upgrades and cannot be mixed regardless of their elite or regular Deployment card status.
As of August 2020, Fantasy Flight Games no longer offers Organized Play support for IA Skirmish. In order to keep competitive skirmish
and organized play fresh and interesting
the pool have been evaluated by the IACP
to provide a balanced skirmish experience. The IACP will be rotating one map out and one map into the pool on a 4-month schedule (17 weeks).
Coruscant Back Alleys (Maul figure pack, Core Set and Heart of the Empire Tiles) - Missions A & B
ISB Training Grounds (ISB Infiltrators pack, Core Set and Bespin Gambit Tiles) - Missions A & B
Endor Defense Station (Capt Terro pack, Core Set and Jabba’s Realm Tiles) - Missions A & B

With the introduction of Season 8, we are adding a new trait to the game for the first time since the release of the official Core set. The Technician trait represents figures whose skills and abilities are mechanically or technically oriented, and for now is functionally just a way to show which figures can play Command cards with the Technician restriction. In addition to including this trait on new figures going forward, existing figures will have the trait added to them with the 0 point Technician Training skirmish upgrade. This adds the Technician trait to all of the figures listed on the card for both armies. This is technically a Deployment card that is included in list-building, however there is currently nothing in the game that can interact with this card, and players can forgo bringing this card if they wish to print out the updated versions of their figures that have had the Technician trait added. However, players who choose not to bring the Technician training card in their list need to accurately represent to their opponent which of their figures are able to play Technician command cards. If any player is unsure about which of their figures or their opponent’s figures are Technicians, it is recommended to keep the Technician Training card on hand as a reference tool.

A Squad Upgrade is a type of Attachment that adds or replaces a figure in a deployment group. Just like a Skirmish Upgrade, rules and abilities that reference Deployment cards do not affect, do not include, and cannot manipulate Squad Upgrade cards unless the rule or ability states otherwise.

After attaching the Squad Upgrade, the Squad Upgrade card’s figure is added as an extra figure to the base group. Unless a Squad Upgrade specifically states that it replaces a model in the base group, no original figure is removed from the base group. The figure provided by the Squad Upgrade uses the health, stats, traits, and abilities

unless otherwise specified. During setup, deploy any figures added from a Squad Upgrade in your deployment zone. These figures are considered part of the attached group for all intents and purposes, but only use the abilities
on the Squad Upgrade card unless otherwise specified.

Unlike regular Attachments, the opponent does not score VPs equal to the cost of the Squad Upgrade when the final figure in a group with a Squad Upgrade is defeated. Instead, that Squad Upgrade card’s points are scored as VPs when the corresponding figure created by that Attachment is defeated.
Q: Can you exhaust a Squad Upgrade as the requirement for playing “Take Initiative”?
Q: Do you exhaust the Squad Upgrade Attachment card when you activate the figure from that Attachment?

A: No, you only need to exhaust the Deployment card for the group the Squad Upgrade card is attached to after you activate that group like normal. The Squad Upgrade figure activates as part of the attached group’s activation regardless of whether the Squad Upgrade card itself is exhausted or readied.
Q: Is a Squad Upgrade Regular or Unique?

A: Squad Upgrades work just like other Deployment Cards and Skirmish Upgrades in this regard. If it has a red border, it is elite and you can only bring two copies in a list. If it’s grey, it is regular and you may have up to 4 copies. If there is a black dot in front of the name, you may only have 1 copy in your list.
Q: Can I use a Squad Upgrade Attachment on a deployment card that already has a Skirmish Upgrade Attachment?
A: No. The Squad Upgrade card is a type of Attachment with added rules and restrictions, and thus cannot be stacked with any other Attachments.
Q: Can I use a Squad Upgrade Attachment on another Squad Upgrade Attachment?
A: No, just like you cannot play an Attachment card on an Attachment.
Q: Does the Squad Upgrade change the deployment cost of the base deployment card
when that is being referenced by other abilities like Strength in Numbers
he Deployment Cost of a Shoretrooper unit is always 7, even when it has a Mortar Trooper attached to it.
Attachments in general do not change a group’s deployment cost.
Q: Do I have to activate the added figure before or after activating the rest of my group?
A: No. The figure added from a Squad Upgrade activates with its attached group, and follows all normal activation rules
Q: If I kill all figures of the base group, is the Squad Upgrade automatically defeated?

A: No. The Squad Upgrade adds a figure to the group. This means that even if all Shoretroopers in a group are defeated, the group is still considered to have models on the board if the Mortar Trooper has not been killed.
Q: When I kill every figure in a group with a Squad Upgrade Attachment, do I also score points for the Squad Upgrade Attachment in addition to the points for killing the figure that came with it?

A: No, unlike Skirmish Upgrade Attachments, you don’t score VPs from the Squad Upgrade Attachment when you defeat the last figure in a group with a Squad Upgrade. Those points get scored when the Squad Upgrade figure is defeated.
Q: Can a Squad Upgrade figure with a cost of 3 be Reinforced even if the base group has a higher figure cost.
A: Yes. A Squad Upgrade figure’s Reinforcement cost is the same as the cost printed on its Squad Upgrade card,

regardless of the Reinforcement cost of the base group that it’s attached to. In the same way, a Squad Upgrade figure that costs 4 or more cannot be brought back with Reinforcements even if it is attached to a base group of figures that have a Reinforcement cost of 3 or less.
Q: If my base group’s figure cost is 3,
but the only remaining figure in their group is from a Squad Attachment,
can I Reinforce the defeated figures in the base group even when they have all been defeated?
A: Yes. As long as a figure in the group is on the board, a figure in that group can be Reinforced. This includes when there is only a Squad Upgrade figure left.
Can a figure from a Squad Upgrade be chosen for the New Orders Command card, and if so what happens?

since the Squad Upgrade figure is a part of the group it’s attached to, any ability that affects that figure’s Deployment card only affects the Deployment card of the attached group, not the Squad Upgrade card itself. If New Orders is played on a Mortar Trooper figure, the Shoretrooper Deployment Card it’s attached to will be readied, not the Mortar Trooper Squad Upgrade card itself.
Q: How does the marked space work with other things that block line of sight and does it affect movement or counting spaces?

A: The marked space blocks line of sight, but does not block movement, adjacency, or counting spaces. The diagonal intersection of the marked space and either a wall, blocking terrain, or energy shield also blocks line of sight. Line of sight can be traced to a figure or object occupying the marked space.
Q: Can this card still be played if Paz has already gained the melee attack type, perhaps to just suffer strain?
A: No, since the card’s effects to perform 2 attacks and gain the melee attack type will have no effect, the card cannot be played. Suffering strain is part of the card’s cost and not its effect.
Q: If Paz would interrupt to perform an attack while resolving the attacks from Overheated, perhaps with Parting Blow, would the -1 damage be applied to those additional attacks as well?
A: No, the -1 damage is only applied to the attacks created by Overheated.
Q: If a hostile figure with 2 Harmful conditions would gain a condition that it already has, will that trigger the re-draw effect of this card?
A: A figure cannot gain an additional instance of a condition it already has and since nothing
happens when a figure would gain a condition it already has, this will not fulfill the requirements to re-draw this card.
Q: Can Leg Hydraulics be used before choosing targets for Cleave?
A: Yes, both Cleave and Leg Hydraulics are applied after the attack resolves and can be applied in any order.
Q: Does discarding a power token to add +1 damage count as spending a power token for effects like Ko-tun’s Dead Precise and K-2SO’s Vague and Unconvincing?
A: No, discarding a power token for Rogue One’s effect does not count as spending a power token for its default effect.
Q: Can the Speeder Bike end its movement overlapping impassable terrain?
A: No, Impassable terrain is only ignored while the Speeder bike is moving. It cannot end its movement in an illegal space.
Q: Does I Know Everything happen before Wookiee Avenger can search for Debts Repaid?

A: I Know Everything happens right before players go to draw their initial hand during setup, which happens after Wookiee Avenger searches for Debts repaid, but before a card like Channel the Force can replace a draw with a search
Q: What does transferring a token mean for You Have Something I Want? Can a figure transfer a condition token that Moff Gideon already has?

A: Transferring a token means that the figure discards the token to be transferred, and the receiving figure gains the exact same type of token that was discarded. If a figure chooses to transfer a condition token that Moff Gideon already has, it discards the chosen token and takes no damage, and nothing happens to Moff Gideon.
Q: Can Punishing Strike replace one of the Harmful conditions with one that was already chosen for Spread the Pain during that attack?

A: Yes. Conditions for Spread the Pain are chosen during the attack, when surge abilities can be used. The conditions are then applied after the attack resolves, and can be modified by Punishing Strike.
Q: When suffering multiple strain, can Paz discard from the Command deck to prevent the first
, then return that discarded Command card to the gamebox to prevent the following damage?
A: Yes, once Paz finishes discarding command cards to prevent an equal amount of damage, he can then game box those discarded cards to prevent any additional damage from the remaining strain.
Retested Season 5; Original version failed to meet required 70% vote threshold to be reverted, April 2021
Can be played in the same attack as Assassinate?
Yes, can be Played with Assassinate
Parting Blow, Hit and Run, Dying Lunge, Extra Protection
Yes, can be Played with Assassinate
Any part of the attack steps, including:
"when you declare an attack", "while attacking", "when a hostile figure suffers damage”
No, cannot be Played with Assassinate
Primary Target, Element of Surprise, Tools for the Job, Heightened Reflexes, Lock On, Blitz, Positioning Advantage, Opportunistic, Disorient
A Command card that has been played but is negated during the attack
No, cannot be Played with Assassinate
When a figure has suffered damage equal to its Health or is defeated during the attack
No, cannot be Played with Assassinate
Command cards played during a new attack that was declared while the current attack is still resolving
No, cannot be Played with Assassinate
"after an attack resolves" or "after you perform an attack"
Yes, can be Played with Assassinate
Shoot the Messenger, Glory of the Kill, Stay Down
Q: If this card is Excavated by Doctor Aphra, can it be used to target a figure while another figure is still under the effects of Disable that was played in the previous turn?

A: Yes. Disable does not stay in play or attach to the figure it targets, it simply creates an effect with a specified duration and then goes to the discard pile immediately. If you target the same figure with Disable that is already under its effects from the previous round, both Disables will wear off at the end of that figure’s next activation.
Changed "add 1 defense die of your choice" to "add 1 black die".
Introduced Season 2; Approved January 2020; Balance Update August 2020.
Lure of the Dark Side FAQ
Q: What happens if the chosen figure already has power tokens on it?

A: The player using Lure only controls the chosen hostile figure while they are attacking. The original owner of the figure chooses which power tokens to keep or discard until their figure has 2 power tokens.
Q: Does this card allow Boba Fett to gain 4 movement points AND perform an attack without spending an action?
A: No. When this card is played, the player must choose to gain 4 movement points or perform the attack.
Q: If this card is played by Technician, can it still trigger cards like To the Limit and All in a Day’s Work?
A: Yes, this card still counts as a
even though it doesn’t cost an action to use.
Q: Can 2 copies of Repair be used in the same activation?
A: Only if one is played by paying the

cost. You cannot play 2 of the same Command card during the same timing window, but since special action costs don’t have a specified timing window, you can pay an action to play a 2nd copy of Repair during the same activation you already played another Repair..
Q: Which droids are used to determine how much damage is dealt to the chosen figure in their line of sight?
A: Only the friendly Droid figures that were moved by this card are used for determining how much damage is dealt to the chosen hostile figure. That can include
the Droid figure using this card, and means that the maximum damage that can be dealt to the chosen figure is 3 damage.
Errata to FFG text to clarify timing window
All in a Day’s Work FAQ
Q: Can this be played after resolving a
that doesn’t cost an action to use, like Chewbacca’s Slam with Wookiee Avenger, or Repair (IACP) being played by a Technician?
A: Yes, what matters is that the ability has the
icon preceding it as a cost. Those abilities are still considered to be special actions even when they don’t actually cost an action to perform (see FFG FAQ pg 10).
Q: Can this be played if it is drawn by a
A: Yes, it will be in your hand by the time the
resolves and you can then play it.
Q: If played by a figure with a Squad Upgrade attachment, will the Squad Upgrade figure benefit from the +1 damage during that group’s activation?
A: Yes, figures added to a group by a Squad Upgrade are part of that group.
Q: When is Blend In discarded during K-2SO’s attack?
A: Blend In is discarded as soon as K-2SO declares an attack.
Q: If a player looks at or reveals Built on Hope from the command deck and then discards it, can it be redrawn?
A: Yes, looking at or revealing a card does not change its location, it is still being discarded from the deck.
Q: What do “Personal Combat Shield” and “Gar Saxon’s Flamethrower” do?
A: Reference the abilities on Gar Saxon’s Deployment card.
Q: What happens if Mara Jade plays this card to give Gar Saxon an additional instance of an ability he already has on his Deployment card?
A: Any additional instance of the same named ability on a Deployment card is redundant and will not stack on the original ability.
Q: Can this card be played with Doctor Aphra’s Excavate if BD-1 is already in play?
A: Yes, BD-1 will be redeployed to Cal’s space when this card is played, and will be in a ready state and able to activate again at the end of Cal’s activation.
Q: If Mara Jade plays this card while Cal Kestis is still in play, will BD-1 activate at the start or end of Mara Jade’s activation for the rest of the mission?
Q: Does this card replace Biv's Command card "Stay Down"?
Q: How does "Stay Down" work with this card?

A: You play "Stay Down" after you have resolved the attack from "Close and Personal". Biv performs an attack using his standard attack pool (and surge abilities) targeting the same target from Close and Personal.
Introduced Season 4; Changed Season 5, Approved April 2021.
Q: Can the 2nd effect of this card be canceled by something like Comm Disruption or Signal Jammer?
A: No, using this card’s 2nd effect is not the same as playing the card from your hand, therefore it cannot be canceled by cards like Comm Disruption if used in that way.
of being unable to discard Weakened
A: No, its effect remains active until the chosen figure leaves play.
Q: What happens if this card is played from the discard pile with Doctor Aphra’s Excavate?

A: The effect will resolve as normal, then Disarm will be removed from play to the game box immediately. However, the chosen figure will still be unable to discard the Weakened condition, as this is not linked to the card being in play. It’s recommended to keep Disarm near the affected figure as a continuing reminder not to discard that figure’s Weakened condition.
Q: Can this card be played if the defender didn’t roll any defense dice, or if the only defense dice results were canceled?
A: Yes. If there are no defense dice in the pool, you will still choose as many valid targets for this card as possible, attack dice, and cancel their results.
Q: What happens if the chosen figure can’t be pushed to a space adjacent to Kallus?
A: The chosen figure will remain in its starting position. Kallus may still perform an attack targeting that figure if able (normal requirements still apply)
Q: Does increasing a figure’s figure cost affect how cards work that mention Deployment cost, like Change of Plans, Strength in Numbers, or Squad Swarm?

A: No, a single figure group’s figure cost is derived from its Deployment cost, not the other way around. You don’t derive a group’s Deployment cost from its figure cost. To determine a figure’s figure cost after playing this card (assuming it is the only starting figure in its group), take its deployment cost and add +2.
Q: Can Baze use this card on himself when he has suffered damage equal to his health?
A: Yes, Baze is a friendly figure to himself and within 3 spaces of himself
and can be played before he is defeated, as an interrupt.
Q: When the chosen opponent's group activates, is Zuckuss forced to attack a figure in that group?
A: No. Zuckuss may choose to attack any figure he is able to attack.
Q: If an attacker plays “Element of Surprise”, then the target is changed with “Get Behind Me!”, does the attacker still remove a defense die?
A: No. “Element of Surprise” removes the die from the original defender’s pool before the target is switched. The new target still has all of its defense dice in its pool.
Q: If an attacker plays “Wild Attack”, and then the target is changed with “Get Behind Me!”, what happens?
A: The attacker will keep the added Red die, but the new defender will not benefit from the added White die, which was applied to the original defender.
Q: If an attacker plays “Primary Target”, and then the target is changed to a figure that does not have the highest figure cost, what happens?
A: The attacker will still be Focused and will still apply +1 damage to the attack results, as the original requirements were met when the card was played.
Q: What cards can the defender play after playing “Get Behind Me!”?
A: Cards use the same timing window as “Bodyguard”: The Declare Target step for effects triggered by the defender or figures friendly to the defender.
has played "Get Behind Me!" or “Bodyguard” and becomes the target of the attack, can
A: Yes. Changing the target of the attack allows the new defender to play cards like “Iron Will” and “Run for Cover” as the timing window is the same as “Get Behind Me!”.
Q: Does damage suffered from abilities like “Relentless” and “Shrapnel” count towards the 3 damage maximum?
A: No. The effect of “Iron Will” only applies during step 7, the Calculate Damage step, of the attack.
Q: Does my defeated Trooper figure that was brought back with Reinforcements or defeated companion figure that was brought back with Spot Weld or Droid mastery count for this card?

A: This card only counts your figures that are currently defeated, not the number of times a friendly figure has been defeated. If a figure has been defeated but was put back into play with a card like Reinforcements or Droid Mastery, that figure is no longer defeated.
Q: If I bring multiple Junk Droid tokens and put out a new one with Spot Weld each time one is defeated, can I count all of my defeated Junk Droid tokens for this card?

A: No, you are limited to one companion token in play at a time with the same name. If you are putting a companion token into play after it was already defeated, it is therefore assumed that you are putting the same companion token into play as the token that was defeated.
Q: Can a player use other abilities to modify the attack from Lightbow?

A: Other figures besides Chirrut may use their abilities or play Command cards to modify the attack, however Chirrut himself cannot use any abilities or Command cards during the attack other than the abilities printed on the Lightbow Command card.
Q: If Overwhelming Impact is played against a Weakened figure, will the -1 evade from Weaken be ignored for that attack?
A: -1 modifiers are canceled out as soon as there is another matching
to cancel it out to zero
, and by the time Overwhelming Impact can be played, the effect of Weaken will have already applied and been canceled out by any evade symbols that were on the dice.

Q: If the defender is Weakened and has an evade result on their dice and a +1 evade result from a passive ability or power token, which evade gets canceled and which one will still be in the defense results when Overwhelming Impact gets played?

A: In this case the defending player would choose which evade would get canceled out by the Weakened condition. If the defender does not clearly state which evade result was canceled, it should be assumed that they canceled the result on the dice last, after any non-dice results were canceled.
Q: When Preservation Protocol is played, when does 4-LOM lose the Trait chosen by that ability?
A: Once Preservation Protocol is resolved, 4-LOM immediately loses the Trait previously chosen by that ability.
Q: Does changing the dice results with this card count as rerolling that die?
A: No, Rapid Recalibration does not reroll any dice.
Q: Which cards are affected while this card is in play?
A: Rebel Graffiti, Data Theft, Targeting Network, Shared Experience, Leia Organa,
Knowledge and Defense (IACP), Built on Hope, De Wanna Wanga, and Doctor Aphra.
Q: Can the attacking figure’s surge abilities be used in addition to the defender’s surge abilities?

A: No, you choose which surge abilities you want to use for the attack when it’s time to spend surges during Step 5 of performing an attack, the spend surges step. You do not need to declare which surge abilities you will be using before you get to the spend surges step.
Q: What happens if the attacker is Focused?

A: Focus adds a Green die to the attack pool as a mission effect before this card can be played. The attacker may include the Green die added by Focus as 1 of their 2 chosen attack dice to keep for that attack.
Q: If a space is targeted without any unlocked doors adjacent, will each figure on or adjacent to that space still suffer the damage?

A: Yes, the figures on or adjacent to the chosen space suffering damage equal to the results on the blue die is not conditional to a door being opened by the effect of the card. They just happen in sequence, independently, so you will open any unlocked doors adjacent to that space first, then figures will suffer damage from the card.
Q: What happens if Cassian attacks a hostile figure that he can see but can’t count spaces to it?
A: If Cassian can see a figure via another friendly figure but can’t count spaces to it, then a required accuracy cannot be established and the attack will miss.
Q: If Marksman is used, does it apply to the line of sight of every friendly figure?
Q: Can the movement and the attack be performed in any order?

A: Yes, however you cannot break up the 2 movement to attack in between, you must fully resolve the 2 movement before or after the attack. You can choose the order of when to resolve this card and Cad Bane’s “I Make the Rules Now” since they have the same timing window.
Q: Can Assassinate (IACP) be played on an attack made with Supercharge?
A: Yes. Unlike other cards that add dice to the dice pool, this card is technically played before the attack as it instructs you to “perform an attack”. See Assassinate reference table below.
Q: Can Del Meeko choose himself with this card?
A: Yes, he can. If he uses this card to interrupt to perform a Move action, he will have to spend all the movement points from that Move immediately as part of this special action.
Q: Can There Is No Try be used to modify a rerolled die?
A: No. The die must be turned immediately after it was rolled. If the die was rolled as part of an attack, then the die is turned during the "Roll Dice" step of the attack.
Q: Does turning a die with There Is No Try count as a reroll for cards like "Tough Luck"?
that was turned by There Is No Try
Q: Can the same figure be chosen more than once?

A: Each chosen figure will only suffer damage once based on the result of the red die. Choosing the same figure multiple times for the ability does not change how much damage it suffers equal to the damage results on the red die rolled.
Q: If Windfall is discarded by Negation or Comm Disruption, can its second effect be used?
A: No, at that point the card has left the player’s hand and is being discarded from play.
Updated Deployment Cards (from existing FFG cards)
Introduced Season 2; Re-introduced Season 3; Approved July 2020.
Q: Can Boba Fett use Wrist Cord or Wrist Flamethrower outside of his activation when he gains movement points (as from Command cards such as "Opportunistic" or "Field Tactician")?
but they are still limited to once per round.
use Wrist Cord or Wrist Flamethrower when he gains movement points from a special action

You can alternate between spending the movement points to move spaces or spending them to use abilities in whatever order you like. As soon as you do something other than spending movement points to do things, any unspent movement points will be lost.
Q: Can Boba Fett use the movement points from "
" to modify his attack pool using EE-3 Carbine?
As soon as Boba Fett stops moving to perform an attack, the unspent movement points from Urgency are immediately lost before EE-3 Carbine can be used.
Q: Can I grab an attack die from outside the attack and roll that for Indiscriminate Fire?
A: No, if that were the case the card would say “roll a non-red attack die,”.
Q: If an attack die’s result is removed by Tough Luck, can it still be chosen for Indiscriminate Fire?
Q: Does the target of the attack suffer the damage from Indiscriminate Fire?
Cost reduced from 8 to 7. Replaced Suppression Text with “...if it did not miss due to accuracy,...”
Introduced Season 3; Approved July 2020; Changed Season 5. Re-approved April 2021

Q: Suppose Biv performs an attack on Han Solo, who is adjacent to C-3PO. Biv's attack results have enough Accuracy to reach Han. Han rolls one defense die, which results in a dodge. Can Biv use Suppression? If so, how much strain does Han suffer?

A: Yes, Biv may spend an available surge to use Suppression. Han has a total of 3 defensive results: The dodge rolled on his white die, an evade granted by C-3PO's "Distracting" ability, and a block granted by Han's "Cunning" ability. Suppression causes Han to suffer a maximum of 2
Introduced Season 3; Approved July 2020; Changed in Season 5, Re-approved April 2021
Q: Can Davith use Fell Swoop while attacking with Dying Lunge?

A: Yes, Fell Swoop and the effect of being defeated by Dying Lunge use the same timing window, after the attack resolves, therefore the controller of each effect may determine the order that they resolve.
Introduced Season 1; Approved July 2019; Changed Season 2; Approved January 2020.
Q: If Defensive Stance is used, can Lock On cancel a Dodge result before Defensive Stance converts it?
A: No, the conversion from Defensive Stance
applies immediately, before Lock On can be played.
Q: Can Forward Emplacement be used after deploying with Lie in Ambush?
A: No, “after deployment” means after the deployment phase at the start of the mission.
Q: If Gaarkhan plays "Parting Blow" or "Dying Lunge", can he use "Brutal Cleave" after the attack granted by the Command card?
If he plays "Parting Blow" or "Dying Lunge"
, then he may use "Brutal Cleave" to perform an extra attack before he becomes Stunned (from "Parting Blow") or becomes defeated (from "Dying Lunge").
He cannot use "Brutal Cleave" if "Parting Blow" or "Dying Lunge" is played outside his activation.
Introduced Season 3; Changed in Season 4; Approved November 2020
Q: Do the Infiltrators become Hidden when they are deployed with Lie in Ambush?
A: Yes, the text used is “when you are deployed” rather than “after deployment”.
Q: When the last figure in a Heavy Stormtrooper group with a reduced cost Attachment is defeated, how is the Attachment scored?

A: The Attachment is scored as normal but using the reduced value from Modular. An Attachment with a printed cost of 1 will score 0 VPs when the final figure is defeated, and a printed cost of 2 will score 1 VP.
Q: Is the figure cost of an attached Squad Upgrade figure reduced by 1?
A: Yes, the figure cost of a Squad Upgrade is tied to the Deployment cost of its Squad Upgrade card, which has its cost permanently reduced by 1 until the end of the mission.
Q: If both Heavy Stormtrooper figures in a group with a Squad Upgrade Attachment are defeated before the Squad Upgrade figure, does the Squad Upgrade’s cost go back to its printed value?
A: No, the cost reduction is applied permanently to the Attachment before the game starts.
Q: Will the Move from Executive Order trigger the extra movement points from General’s Ranks?
A: Yes, as performing a Move involves gaining movement points.
Q: Can Jyn use "Sidewinder" after she performs an attack outside of her activation (such as from Leia Organa's "Battlefield Leadership" or Jyn's "Hair Trigger")?
A: Yes, Jyn can use Sidewinder after any attack.
Q: What does it mean to double a die’s results? Can I Tough Luck/Heightened Reflexes a die’s results that have been doubled?

A: All icons (damage, surges, blocks, evades, dodges) and Accuracy results on that die are treated as being multiplied by x2. The doubled results are still considered to be part of the die’s results, and if that die’s results are canceled by a card like Tough Luck or Heightened Reflexes, all of the die’s results are removed.
Q: Does Cheat to Win work with Shrewd Scoundrel?

A: Yes, Lando may play Cheat to Win before resolving the 2nd part of Shrewd Scoundrel’s ability. At the end of attack step 3, the die’s result will be doubled if the current result matches the number that was guessed for Shrewd Scoundrel.
Q:What happens if a white die Dodge is doubled by Shrewd Scoundrel, and the opponent uses a -1 Dodge effect like Lock On or Deadly?

A: Abilities that apply -1 Dodge to the defense results do not change what is on the dice. The Dodge on the white die will be doubled at the end of attack step 3, and then 1 Dodge is subtracted during the modify results step. If any Dodges remain, the attack misses.
Q: If Lando makes another figure reroll with something like Battlefield Awareness, can he use Gambit on the other figure’s rerolled die? What about Shrewd Scoundrel?

A: Lando can use Gambit while using Battlefield Awareness on another figure to allow that figure to reroll into a different color die, even a die that is being rolled outside of an attack, such as Sabine’s Parting Gift. However, Shrewd Scoundrel is limited to being used while Lando is attacking or defending, so unless he is letting another figure reroll a die with Battlefield Awareness while he is attacking or defending, Shrewd Scoundrel cannot be used with Battlefield Awareness.
Q: Can another friendly figure be chosen to receive 1 movement point from Battlefield Leadership if the target of the attack is defeated?

A: Yes, Leia can choose another friendly figure for the 2nd effect of Battlefield Leadership even if the target of Leia’ attack is defeated. The chosen figure will be able to receive and spend the movement point but won’t be able to perform the attack from Battlefield Leadership as there is no legal target.
Q: Can Leia choose herself for Battlefield Leadership?
A: No, Leia must choose another friendly figure to gain 2 movement points and perform the 2nd attack with Battlefield Leadership.
Q: Does the Recon token do anything if Loku is defeated?
A: No, if Loku is defeated, he no longer applies his ability to apply Pierce 1 to all friendly attacks targeting that figure.
Q: If a friendly figure would suffer multiple strain from the same ability, can Murne suffer one damage for each one to prevent each one?
A: No, since multiple strain from the same source is suffered at the same time, you can only prevent 1 strain from that source by suffering 1 damage.
Q: If Murne prevents a strain with Figurehead, can abilities that trigger from a figure suffering strain, like Under Duress
A: Figurehead precedes and prevents strain from being suffered, so if all strain that would have been suffered is prevented, abilities that trigger from figures suffering strain cannot be used.
Q: Can Figurehead be used to prevent strain being suffered to pay a cost for an ability?

A: No. If strain would be prevented from being suffered that is required to pay a cost to use an ability, then the cost is not paid and the ability will not resolve. Since players cannot use abilities that will have no effect, Figurehead cannot be used to prevent a cost from being paid to use an ability.
Q: How does an attack resolve if “Strike Me Down” is used?

A: Obi-Wan will be defeated without suffering any damage and any cards that trigger from a figure being defeated may be used. Then, per FFG: If the attack is interrupted and subsequently has no target, no further steps should be taken and it is resolved immediately. This is treated the same as if the defender was defeated as an interrupt during the attack. The attacker cannot then spend surges or resolve any later parts of the attack. Any effects that would affect either the target or target space become invalid.
Q: If I use “Strike Me Down”, can I then use a card like “Dying Lunge”, ”Second Chance”, or ”Miracle Worker”?
A: No. Obi-Wan does not suffer damage equal to his health, he is simply defeated.
Q: If the Rancor performs an attack with Dying Lunge, can it use Trained to reroll a die?

A: Yes. Normally a figure cannot suffer damage above its max health and would not be able to pay the cost of Trained, but suffering strain is different from suffering damage. The Rancor player does not need to discard any cards either.
Introduced Season 3; Approved July 2020; Balance Update August 2020.
Q: Which figures discard their Harmful conditions with Hardy?
A: Each Trandoshan Hunter figure discards all of their
conditions at the end of each round.
Q: Can this version of the card be played alongside 4 copies of the original FFG version of the card?
A: No, per our rules for IACP, IACP Skirmish Upgrades with the same name as an existing FFG Skirmish Upgrade cannot be used together in the same list.
Q: If the second ability is used to force the opponent to discard, how many cards are discarded?
A: Since Under Duress must be depleted to use the ability, the first ability
is no longer active and only one card will be discarded.
Q: If a hostile figure would suffer multiple strain from a single source, can Under Duress be depleted to resolve the choices made for all of that strain?

A: Yes, for example, if a hostile figure would suffer 3 strain from a single source, you can deplete Under Duress to have them discard up to 3 command cards from their deck to prevent that much damage from the strain and suffer the remaining strain as damage.
Q: Can the deplete effect be used to make choices for effects like Murne’s Figurehead or Paz’s Submit or Fight ability that prevents strain or prevents damage from strain?

A: No, Under Duress only allows you to resolve the default choices for strain for the opponent to discard a command card to prevent damage, and any choices that would specifically modify the strain effect itself. For example, in a 4-player game, if you deplete your Under Duress to use its effect and another player has an active Under Duress, you would choose whether the opponent discards 2 cards from their deck for each damage you wish to prevent that figure suffering from the strain.
Q: When using Close Quarters, do I have to target the adjacent figure whose attack pool I’m using for the attack?
A: No, you can target any legal hostile figure that Verena can currently attack with her current weapon type that has been set by Close Quarters (ranged or melee).
Q: What happens when Close Quarters targets a figure with Arsenal or Epic Arsenal like General Weiss?

A: Per the Return to Hoth rulebook, the controller of the figure with Arsenal chooses its attack pool for Close Quarters to use. For Epic Arsenal, the attack pool cannot be more than 2 dice of any color.
The player controlling the Arsenal figure sets the dice pool just before dice are rolled, after any “on declare” abilities have been used.
Q: Does Lasat Honor Guard only trigger if a die is
A: No. “After any rerolls” refers to the reroll step of the
attack. This ability is used after the reroll step but before
any other attack modifiers are applied, regardless of
whether a die has been rerolled.
Luke Skywalker, Hero of the Rebellion
Introduced Season 1; Approved July 2019; Changed Season 5.Re-approved April 2021
Introduced Season 2; Approved January 2020; Changed Season 5. Re-approved April 2021
Q: Upon setup, can 4-LOM have a Skirmish Upgrade Attachment (such as "Prey on the Weak" or "Survivalist") that requires a Trait that 4-LOM can receive via "Programming Override"?
Q: If at the start of a round, 4-LOM chooses to have the "Force User" trait, can 4-LOM play "Rebel Force User" or "Imperial Force User" Command cards such as "Force Push" or "Dark Energy"?
A: No. 4-LOM is not a Rebel or Imperial faction figure.
Q: If 4-LOM is currently a Brawler and played Parting Blow after using Concussive Bolt, can it use Concussive Bolt on the 2nd attack to play a 2nd copy of Parting Blow?
A: Yes, Concussive Bolt resolves before the Stun from the first Parting Blow would happen.
Q: If 4-LOM became a Creature at the start of the round, can he be chosen to attack for Ferocity that round?
A: No, Programming Override wears off before end-of-round effects happen.
Q: Can Hunt Dissent’s range be extended with Advanced Com Systems?
A: Yes, figures within 1 space are also within 2 spaces.
Q: How long does Kallus gain the melee attack type with Bo-Rifle?
A: For the duration of the attack it’s being used on.
Q: Can Agent Kallus play Dying Lunge?
A: Yes, Dying Lunge instructs the figure to perform a melee attack. If Kallus is able to perform a melee attack against a legal target using the Bo-Rifle ability, he may do so.
Q: Can Agent Kallus use Pummel?
A: No. Pummel is worded in a way that an attack can only be performed if the figure already has the melee attack type, and Bo-Rifle can only be used if an attack is already being declared.
Q: Can Agent Kallus use Deathblow?
A: If Kallus uses Bo-Rifle to change his attack type to melee, he can then use Deathblow which happens in the same timing window.
Q: If the first command card played by an opponent deals damage to Agent Kallus and defeats him, can he still use Hunt Dissent?
A: Yes, Hunt Dissent triggers when a card is played, but before it resolves.
Chirrut Imwe, Guardian of the Whills
Q: What happens if the opponent’s group targeted by Force Slow is the only figure they have left to activate that round?

A: The opponent’s next opportunity to resolve an activation is usually also their first opportunity to resolve an activation. Since they cannot activate the chosen group during their first opportunity to activate a group and have no other groups to activate, they will not be able to activate any groups during that opportunity to activate. Then the Cal Kestis player will resolve their opportunity to activate a group, at which point it then becomes the opponent’s 2nd opportunity to activate a group, and they can now activate the group that was chosen for Force Slow.
It is important to note that the activation phase does not end until all ready deployment groups have activated.
Q: What happens if Kanan’s Force Vision is used to name a Deployment group that can’t activate due to Cal’s Force Slow?
A: Can’t and cannot completely override must abilities, which means that Force Vision and similar abilities cannot compel a group to activate if it’s unable to activate due to Force Slow.
Q: If Cara Dune pushes an adjacent figure with Smash and then plays Parting Blow to attack that figure, where is the target space used to determine the Blast radius from?
A: Parting Blow interrupts the target’s movement to perform the attack, thus the target space when determining the Blast radius is the original space the target was in before it was pushed by Smash.
Q: For Hunker Down, what if there is blocking or impassable terrain only on one edge of a space?

A: For Cara to be able to use Hunker down, her figure must share an edge or corner with the edge of the space that has the blocking or impassable terrain on it. If her figure’s edge or corner is not touching the edge of the space which has terrain only on its edge, she cannot use Hunker Down.
Q: How does Flawless Execution interact with Primary Target?

A: Flawless Execution will have already resolved when Primary Target can be played. Cad Bane will apply +1 damage from Primary Target, but cannot alter the Green die granted by Primary Target’s Focus.
Clan of Two & The Child Companion
Clan of Two & The Child FAQ
Q: Is there a single unified definition for Incapacitated?
A: Yes, please reference Pasi’s consolidated Imperial Assault rules under heading “Incapacitated”:
Q: After the Guardian figure attached with Clan of Two is defeated, if The Child has not been incapacitated, can it still be attacked?
A: Yes, but its abilities are still active (though it cannot activate), so it can still use Force Exhaustion to incapacitate itself and become immune to damage.
Q:Can The Child be retrieved by another unique figure after the Guardian has been defeated if The Child has not been incapacitated yet?
Q:If a unique figure is carrying the Child, does the child get pushed to an adjacent space at the end of that figure’s activation?
A: No, that ability only applies to the Guardian figure that Clan of Two was originally attached to.
Q: Can The Child use faction restricted Command cards?
A: Yes, per the official rules for companions, The Child’s faction affiliation will be the same as the figure that Clan of Two is attached to.
Q: If the Child figure is attacked and defeated, does it become Incapacitated instead?
A: No, if the Child’s controller allows an attack to resolve without using Force Exhaustion and the Child is defeated, its companion token is removed from play.
Q: Is the Incapacitated Child figure counted for abilities like Cower?
A: Incapacitated figures are still recognized by abilities that check for a figure’s presence but do not affect that figure, such as Cower and Improvised Cover.
Q: What happens if the Child cannot be pushed to a space on or adjacent to the attached figure?

A: As the Child can effectively be pushed an infinite number of spaces to get back to its attached figure, the player should use any route possible to push the Child to that figure, including mission effects that allow moving figures to be placed in another space on the board without ending their movement. If there is no possible movement route to get back to the attached figure, The Child will remain in its original space without being pushed.
Q: Can Maul be chosen for It Will be Alright?
A: Maul can only be chosen if Sustained by Rage is not currently preventing him from being defeated.
Q: Can “It Will Be Alright” be used without choosing a friendly figure within 2 spaces, since it says “you may”?
A: “You may” is referring to the entire ability being optional. If you choose to use the ability during Cassian’s activation, you must do everything it says.
Q: Can a Force User with Darksaber attached use any Imperial only Command cards?

A: A Force User with Darksaber attached effectively ignores the Imperial only restriction on Imperial only Command cards, but must still meet any other restrictions on the card, such as restrictions to a specific unique figure or a trait.
Q: Can the movement points gained from Stalk Prey be used between the two attacks from The Darksaber?
A: No, those movement points will be banked if they are gained during Maul’s activation and cannot be spent while resolving the special action on Darksaber.
Corrective errata to Durasteel Fist, March 2022
Q: Does Advanced Targeting Computer add +1 damage if a die is rerolled with another effect like Targeting Network?
A: No, only the die rerolled with A.T.C. will trigger the ability.
Q: What happens if a die rerolled with A.T.C. is
A: The modifier will be applied based on the rerolled result, regardless of whether the rerolled die was canceled.
Q: Can 0-0-0 be brought in a list without BT-1 using Dubious Counterparts, or vice versa?
No, both droids must be brought together or not at all if using Dubious Counterparts to include them.
Q: Can the 2nd part of Dubious Counterparts be used if only 0-0-0 or BT-1 were included in a list with Aphra using an external card like the Jawa Scavenger?
A: Yes, the extra action can be gained regardless of how the figures were included in the list.
Q: Can a start of round card like Fuel Upgrade be played in the same round that it's chosen by Excavation?
Q: If a card is played at the start of the round, can Aphra Excavate that card and play it again in the same round?
A: No, because a command card with the same name cannot be played by the same player during the same timing window.
Q: Can I still play the chosen card if Aphra has been defeated before the end of the round?
A: No, if Aphra is removed from play, the 2nd part of her Excavation ability is no longer in play and can no longer be used.
If Aphra is defeated while an Excavated card is resolving, that card will still resolve and be returned to the game box.
Q: What happens if Aphra excavates a card that gets put into play as part of its resolution, like Signal Jammer
, or gets canceled and discarded by a card like Negation
A: The card will be put into play but will then be immediately returned to the game box by Excavation’s final ability before any additional abilities on the card in play can be used.
If the Excavated card is canceled by Negation, it will be discarded and then immediately returned to the game box.
Q: If Aphra excavates an opponent’s card that costs a special action like Planning, can a figure play both the excavated Planning and a copy of Planning from their hand
A: Yes, because they are special actions coming from 2 different cards, they are not considered to be the same special action.
Q: Do the Ewoks become Hidden from Ambush even if they are deployed by Lie in Ambush?
Q: If a figure is dealt damage immediately after the Flametrooper’s attack with something like Collateral Damage or Heavy Fire, will that figure suffer strain from wIncinerate?

A: Yes, since the attacking player can resolve “after this attack resolves” abilities in any order, they can deal snowith cards like Collateral Damage and Heavy Fire and then choose to use Incinerate, which will apply to any figure that suffered damage from the time the Flametrooper declared it’s attack.
Q: Can the Flametrooper suffer Strain to pay costs?
A: No, abilities that require a figure to suffer strain as a cost (ie “suffer 1<strain> to…”), like Director Krennic and Fool Me Once, cannot be used by the Flametrooper.
Q: Can the defender choose to become Bleeding for [Query] if they are already Bleeding?
A: Yes, they can choose to become Bleeding instead of applying +1 damage to the attack results, in which case nothing will happen.
Q: If I have Last Resort attached to IG-11, can I use it and use Self-Destruct Protocol?

A: You can deplete Last Resort and then use Self-Destruct Protocol, but you cannot use Last Resort after using Self-Destruct Protocol, which would defeat IG-11 before any other abilities can be used in that timing instance.
Health Increased to 13 for Season 9, March 2024
Q: Can Jyn Erso use Trust Goes Both Ways if she is not adjacent to a friendly figure at the start or end of her activation?
A: No, she must be adjacent to a friendly figure when she wishes to use Trust Goes Both Ways.
Q: Can Jyn Erso use the Tonfa Strike action to just move 2 spaces and perform her ranged attack without performing the melee attack?
A: Yes, the melee attack is optional and Tonfa Strike can still be used even when a melee attack cannot be performed, but she must perform the ranged attack if able.
Q: Can any other figure other than K-2SO play command cards while he is defending?
A: No, K-2SO’s player or the opponent cannot play any command cards while he is defending.
Q: Is K-2SO restricted to having only 1 power token when gaining a token with Cassian Said I Had To?
Please refer to the Squad Upgrades rules & FAQs in the New Rules section below.
Q: Does Haul allow me to end my movement on blocking and impassable terrain?
A: No, Haul only applies while the figure is moving, if it wishes to end its movement it will have to do so without occupying blocking or impassable terrain squares.
Corrective Errata to Expendable Allies, March 2022
: Who scores VPs first for Expendable Allies?
A: The VPs from the ability and from the defeated figure are scored at the same time.
Q: Can I include the Darksaber Attachment in my army with Moff Gideon even if I don’t have Maul?
A: Yes. Because Spoils of Mandalore allows The Darksaber to be attached to Moff Gideon, it is legal to include the Darksaber in an army that includes Moff Gideon.

Q: If Moff Gideon chooses a group with I Know Everything, but the opponent passes or another friendly group is activated with Strength in Numbers, can the chosen group suffer strain if it activates next after that?
A: No. If the very next activation of the round is not the chosen group, those figures do not suffer strain.
Q: Can Expendable Allies be used if a mission has an effect that counts players as having a certain number of VPs based on various conditions?
A: Yes, Expendable Allies will trigger whenever that player’s countable VPs increase, either by gaining VPs or by counting as having additional VPs from a variable mission effect.
Q: What does Disruptor Rifle’s text mean?

A: If the target of the attack has only 1 health “point” remaining after this attack resolves, the target will immediately suffer 1 damage, most likely defeating it. In Imperial Assault, a figure’s Health number stays the same even as it takes damage, which is why the ability is worded this way.
Q: Will Disruptor Rifle work even if the target suffered no damage from the actual attack?

A: Yes, so long as the attack didn’t miss on Accuracy or because of a Dodge, if the defender blocked all the damage but had only 1 health “point” remaining after the attack resolved, the Disruptor Rifle will deal that last point of damage to them.
REMOVED FROM IACP in August 2022 AFTER ADDITIONAL SEASON 7 REBALANCE PLAYTESTING
NOT LEGAL FOR IACP ORGANIZED PLAY
Q: Is the 8 point version of the Mandalorian still legal in IACP?
A: Yes, this is a separate version of this character that can be used instead of the Mandalorian from Season 4.
Q: Can I use this version of Mando and the 8 point Renegade Hunter version in the same list?
A: No, since they have the same name and are unique, they cannot be included in the same list together.
Q: If an opponent attacks The Child companion, and the Child uses Force Exhaustion to become Incapacitated, can Mando still use Protective Fire against the attacker?
Q: Can Mara Jade use Sniper Configuration to perform a melee attack on a non-adjacent figure?
A: No, Sniper Configuration changes how line of sight is drawn, but not the adjacency requirement for melee attacks.
Q: Can a Droid adjacent to Mara use Devotion to search for any command card with a named restriction?
A: No, Fast Learner does not change Mara’s name.
Q: If Mara Jade is used in a list with Sabine Wren, can she play Rebel Graffiti and then re-draw it?

A: No, Fast Learner ignores the play restriction on Command cards restricted to a specific named figure, and Rebel Graffiti’s restriction is Rebel figures only. Since Mara Jade is not named Sabine Wren, it will not trigger the re-draw effect of the card. Additionally, Mara Jade cannot play Rebel Graffiti if she is being played outside of a Rebel list, because she would not meet the faction restriction of Rebel Graffiti.
Q: Can Mara Jade use a Rebel figure’s Command card with Fast Learner even if she is a Mercenary figure due to Adaptive Skills and the Command card has a Rebel faction restriction on it?

A: Yes, Fast Learner lets Mara play a Command Card whose restriction matches the name of another deployment card in Mara’s army, regardless of any other restrictions in the restriction bar under the art. She must still follow all other timing restrictions in the text box.
Migs Mayfeld, Survivor of Burnin Konn
Q: Can I discard any type of power token to use Droid Arm?
A: Yes, any type of power token can be spent to pay the cost of this ability, regardless of whether they are an offensive or defensive power token.
Q: When attacking with Droid Arm, is range counted from Mayfeld’s figure or the adjacent space?
A: Range is still counted from the attacking figure’s space regardless of how line of sight is being drawn.
Q: If a hostile figure opens a door, and is now adjacent
to an Overwatch token but was not in the E-Web’s line of
sight before the door opened, can the E-Web interrupt to
attack it after the door opens?
A: No, the figure will have to enter a space on or
adjacent to the Overwatch token and also be in the
E-Web’s line of sight for the attack interrupt to occur.
Q: Can I place an Overwatch token with my E-Web if I
already have an Overwatch in play that’s associated with
A: Yes, first you remove the Overwatch token that’s
already in play and then place it in a new space in your
E-Web’s line of sight. There can only be one Overwatch
token in play for each copy of Overwatch, and they
should be clearly marked to show which E-Web groups they are associated with if there are multiples.
Q: Do Neutral figures that can be targeted by abilities that target hostile figures (ie Triple Cross) trigger the attack from Overwatch?
A: No, the trigger for overwatch only triggers on hostile figures and does not target.
Can a figure use Single Purpose to perform the special action on this card twice?
A: No, not unless the figure doing so also has Assault or can otherwise perform multiple attack actions during their activation, as the special action on this card includes performing an attack.
Q: Can the Purge Commander use Coordinated Hunt on its own attack?
A: Yes, as the Purge Commander is friendly to itself

Q: If a Pathfinder attacks at the start of the round with Call the Vanguard and uses Distracting Fire, but its controller then activates first with initiative, does the opponent still have to activate the figure targeted by Distracting Fire?
A: No, if the figure’s group targeted by Distracting Fire cannot be the next group to activate during that round, then Distracting Fire has no effect on that figure.
Q: Can Infiltration be used after deploying with Lie in Ambush?
A: No, “after deployment” means after the deployment phase at the start of the mission.
Q: Can multiple Purge Trooper groups use the same Loadout?
A: Yes, each Loadout is not unique and can be used more than once.
Q: If the attack from “On the Hunt” is redirected to a non-unique figure with a card like Bodyguard, will the attack still have +1 damage applied?

A: Yes, the +1 damage is applied to the attack immediately upon performing the attack and will not be undone because the target has been changed to a non-unique figure after the attack has already been declared. .
Q: What happens when this figure attacks a large figure?
A: Lare figures are considered to be adjacent to each space they occupy, therefore a large figure will suffer an additional damage from Electro-pulse after being attacked by this figure.
Q: Do Conditions like Hide or Weaken on the defender trigger Quick Strike?
A: Only modifications controlled by the defending player are counted. Conditions are mission effects that are not controlled by a player.
Q: Do innate defense modifications like Luke Skywalker’s +1 block trigger Quick Strike’s damage?
A: Yes, that counts as a defensive modifier controlled by the defending player.
Q: Does Brutal Tactics trigger before Dying Lunge or Parting Shot?
A: No, Brutal Tactics triggers after a figure is defeated, not when it suffers damage. Use the defeated figure’s last occupied space to count spaces for Brutal Tactics.
Q: If the attack misses, can the figure who exhausts "Suppressive Fire" still choose a friendly figure to gain 2 movement points?

A: The Status Phase happens just before the end of the round, when all Deployment cards are readied and players draw their Command cards for the turn. See Page 23 of the FFG Rules Reference Guide for more information.
Q: Can a player choose whether they want their cards to return to their hand at the start of the next activation or the next phase?
A: No, the cards will be returned to hand automatically at the start of the next activation or the next phase, whichever comes first. This timing is not optional.
Q: What happens to the other revealed card that doesn’t get moved?
A: It doesn’t change position. If it was on the top of the deck and the bottom card was moved to the top, then the unmoved top card becomes the 2nd card from the top, etc.
Q: What happens if a player plays Strategic Shift and their opponent exhausts Smuggling Compartment to set aside their hand?

A: After the opponent’s hand is set aside with Smuggling Compartment, the player resolving Strategic Shift then chooses to target themself or their opponent with the effect. If the opponent is chosen, they will shuffle their deck and draw 2 cards, then add the set aside cards to their now 2-card hand when instructed to.
Q: Can Madness be used if Taron’s controller has
Command cards in hand at the start of his activation but discards down to 2 or less at the start of his activation using another ability like Forbidden Knowledge?
A: Players can order abilities with the same timing instance in any way they choose. So long as Taron’s controller has 2 or fewer Command cards in hand
during his start of activation timing window, the ability will trigger
Q: Can Taron’s controller choose not to use Madness if they have 2 cards in hand or less?

A: Madness is not optional and must trigger even if Taron is already Focused. Madness must also be used if another start of activation effect causes Taron’s controller to drop to 2 cards in hand or less at the start of his activation. Additionally, players cannot choose to use Madness before any other start of activation abilities if they currently have 3 or more cards in hand. .
Q: Can friendly Force Users use any Command card with the Imperial icon in its restriction bar while Taron Malicos is in play?

A: Fallen Master only lets friendly Force Users ignore the Imperial faction requirement on Command cards. They must still meet all other requirements to play the card, like figure name or trait requirements.
Q: Yoda doesn’t have “Non-Combatant”. Does this mean he can use cards like “Set for Stun”, or attack if he’s Focused or has a power token?

A: No. Yoda does not have a specified attack type, which means he cannot naturally perform an attack, and any ability that requires him to perform an attack will fail. The only way Yoda can attack is if an ability grants him an attack with a defined attack type and attack dice pool, like “Improvised Weapons”.
Q: If Yoda is defeated by an attack, can he still use Force Deflection against the attacker?
A: No, Yoda and his abilities would be removed from play before the attack resolves.
Q: If a defending figure plays a card like “On the Lam” to move out of the attacker’s line of sight and adjacent to a friendly Yoda, can Yoda use “Force Deflection”?
that if the defender moves out of line of sight during the attack, then the attack no longer has a target and abilities that reference a target do not resolve.
